intro: Phaca flava, commonly known as yellow phaca, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many species with milky sap and showy flowers. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stem and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a waxy coating. Phaca flava is typically found in grasslands and open woodlands, thriving in well-drained soils.
